CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 24, 1959, page 4, reads: "Ride 'Inaugural Special' - Among the 500 well wishers who rode the Allegheny County Democratic 'Inaugural Special' train to Harrisburg. Tuesday, to see and hear Gov. David L. Lawrence accept the oath of office, was this happy group caught by The Courier photographer, just before the train pulled out. Front row, left to right: Mmes. Jean Farrish and Gladys Coffey. Second row, same order: Frank McFann and Milton (Coast) Blout of Homestead; Ralph Mellix, Mrs. Henrietta Fuller, Gladys Coleman and Homestead Councilman Walter Rowe. Third row: Unidentified passenger; Robert E. (Pappy) Williams, Jacob (Jake) Williams and Fred Terry. Fourth row: 'Texas' Polk (face partly hidden), Howard Dammond and John Cundieff. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of three unknown women, and eleven men, some wearing ribbons inscribed "Fifth Ward Democratic Organization," including, left to right, standing: unknown, Tommy Smith, John Cundieff, Howard Dammond, Jacob Williams, unknown, unknown, unknown, Robert E. "Pappy" Williams; seated: Fred Terry, and two unknowns squatting with suitcases, gathered outside of train station with "Members of the Armed Forces, Welcome to  Pittsburgh, The Salvation Army Canteen" and "Restaurant in Main Waiting Room" signs, another version
